Flow.description: A Flow Template for creating a Summit Event

formulas.description: Used to assign Null to a number field.
formulas.name: formula_NullValue

Flow.label: Summit Event - Template

fields.name: QuestionHeader
fields.fieldText: Custom Question {!varAdvancedQuestionCounter} of {!How_many_Advanced_Questions}

fields.name: Debug_SDFGHJK
fields.fieldText:
Could automation after insert/update check the Map to Field, identify the text field's length and then update this value to keep it accurate to the destination field's natural limit?


Could the UI do this check instead? I suspect from a performance perspective, it's better to do it this way, but maybe remove it from the user to get it right?


Same logic could be applied for a numeric input (number of decimals).

fields.name: Debug_LKJHGF
fields.fieldText:
Could the query builder from USF be helpful for the WHERE clause?


Use Object & Field Picket from USF?

I wonder if there's a multiple field picker solution on USF.


Use the Icon Selector from USF?


If custom questions are only mapped to the registration record, couldn't automation determine the Lookup Object if it has to match the lookup of the Field? (Similar to text length automation)

fields.name: Advanced_Questions_Instructions
fields.fieldText:
Before proceeding, this process must loop through the number of advanced questions to be asked of attendees.


This is temporary until the Repeater element is made generally available.

fields.name: Event_Custom_Questions_Description
fields.helpText: If entered these instructions will appear on the custom questions page if there are any related list custom question records.

fields.name: Event_Appointment_Description
fields.helpText: If entered these instructions/description that appear before the appointment options section of the event

fields.name: Event_Submit_Description
fields.helpText: This text appears at the top of the submit page where confirmation of selections is given and the user submits their registration.

screens.description: Ask user for Basic Questions (up to 5)

fields.name: CreateFirstInstanceDescription
fields.fieldText:
By default, we assume you will also want to create the first instance of this event.


If not, please toggle to No

fields.helpText: Second fee associated with this event. Can be useful for splitting fees between donation and event costs.
